art.capt: duck 1a (male): 1 bean, 2 bill, 3 nostril, 4 head, 5 eye, 6 auricular region, 7 neck, 8 cape, 9 shoulder, 10, 11 wing coverts, 12 saddle, 13 secondaries, 14 primaries, 15 rump, 16 drake feathers, 17 tail, 18 tail coverts, 19 down, 20 shank, 21 web, 22 breast, 23 wing front, 24 wing bow

entry.et: Middle English duk, doke, from Old English dūce

def.dt: :any of various swimming birds (family Anatidae, the duck family) in which the neck and legs are short, the feet typically webbed, the bill often broad and flat, and the sexes usually different from each other in plumage
:the flesh of any of these birds used as food
:darling often used in plural but singular in construction

art.cap: duck 1a (male): 1 bean, 2 bill, 3 nostril, 4 head, 5 eye, 6 auricular region, 7 neck, 8 cape, 9 shoulder, 10, 11 wing coverts, 12 saddle, 13 secondaries, 14 primaries, 15 rump, 16 drake feathers, 17 tail, 18 tail coverts, 19 down, 20 shank, 21 web, 22 breast, 23 wing front, 24 wing bow

entry.et: Middle English douken; akin to Old High German tūhhan to dive, Old English dūce duck

def.dt: :to plunge under the surface of water
:to lower the head or body suddenly :dodge
:to evade a duty, question, or responsibility

entry.et: Dutch doek cloth; akin to Old High German tuoh cloth

def.dt: :a durable closely woven usually cotton fabric
:light clothes and especially trousers made of duck
:a device for imitating the calls of ducks
:a pronounced and unintended hook in golf
:a thick sauce in Chinese cuisine that contains fruits (as plums or apricots), vinegar, sweeteners, and seasonings
